"Surf City" is a song written by Brian Wilson and Jan Berry about a fictitious surf 
spot where there are "two girls for every boy." It was first recorded and made 
popular by the American duo Jan and Dean in 1963, and their single became the 
first surf song to become a national number-one hit. ... music which was largely 
inspired by East Coast black vocal group records.
